content: i want to see nice ampersands! please give me some nice links! classical, decorative, wild, swoooshy, anything but geometrical...
author: core

comments.content:
Some pictures i've found:   
   
 [http://www.bleu.net/esperluette/esperl00.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.bleu.net/esperluette/esperl00.gif)   
 [http://www.adobe.fr/type/topics/theampersand.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.adobe.fr/type/topics/theampersand.html)   
 [http://www.ampersandpress.com/faq/images/faqmain.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.ampersandpress.com/faq/images/faqmain.jpg)   
 [http://www.legamedia.net/legapractice/due-finance/2001/01-12/ampersand.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.legamedia.net/legapractice/due-finance/2001/01-12/ampersand.gif)   
   
Otherwise, your Filt's ampersand looks nice!   
   
Greg

Look through the Typo-L archives for some good past discussions about ampersands, including some great sources.   
   
 [http://listserv.heanet.ie/typo-l.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/listserv.heanet.ie/typo-l.html)   
   
hhp

Don't forget [Classica Prestige!](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.presencetypo.com/pdf/Prestige.pdf) (ampersands on page two)   
   
Also check out the ampersands in Luc[as] de Groot's Thesis family. There's a nice detailed animation of them at [his site](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/lucasfonts.com/).   
   
There was an old _Font & Function_ with a good ampersand article. 1993 or 1994, maybe.

My own favorite ampersands: [Trump Mediaeval italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.myfonts.com/Character?id=0026&vid=114351&charset=CP2&charpage=), [Cochin italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.myfonts.com/Character?id=0026&vid=114512&charset=CP2&charpage=), and [Michelangelo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/bertholdtypes.com/bq_library/090172000.html).

Like the "@", the "&" is a character that I think has exceptional room to evolve (and you know I like "progressive" design). One of my favorites has to be the one in Triplex Italic.   
 [http://www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PTriItL.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.emigre.com/dp/getfontpage.php?PTriItL.html)   
   
BTW, I never realized that Michelangelo has hybrid figures! So does Loire by Jean Lochu:   
 [http://www.daidala.com/loire.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/www.daidala.com/loire.html)   
   
hhp
Don't forget the ampersand of Anisette!

\>Don't forget the ampersand of Anisette!   
   
Pacman eating a mars bar!

"There was an old Font & Function with a good ampersand article..."   
   
this one?   
 [http://fountain.nu/theambersand.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127/http:/fountain.nu/theambersand.jpg)   
   
/peter

I posted because: I am building a bonus font for Fountain, and the type is tall and strict, sans serif, all caps, quite rigid. And: I wanted to totally break it off with a swooschy out-of-place ampersand... The problem is that most nice-looking et-signs are very wide, and I want it to be very tall, but still decorative and classic, calligraphic. Thank you for all the links. Thanks Greg, here it is for others to see:   
 ![Filt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/2926.jpg)

Hola, estos son mis mas nuevos ampersands. I hope you like them or make some good old usual copy/inspiration/critizicism/opinion or howevwr you want to call the forms. This is probably very nineties but it is mexican. Give feedback thank yous...   
 ![ands2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/2971.gif)

heres some more. the name of this font is exboy kf   
 ![ands2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20150104012127im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/2972.gif)
IMO, the best ampersand ever is in Bitstream's Cooper Light.

this is the first time i'm visiting this site. I am a talented graphic designer in NYC, and i'm totally crazy about typography. But lately this economy is really really getting to me. Once upon a time, getting a freelance job was nothing more than a phone call.... this days its like knocking on doors for weeks. I must say sometimes, i'm even thinking about changing my career all together. Please if anyone of you know of any designs firms that are hiring or need a great designer full time. Please post it on this board.... thanks   
Ciao   
\_ania ;)

Hmmm, how did this 'bot choose my post to replicate?

hhp
There are entire ampersand blogs you could look up, and Flickr pools.
